unnormalised: Planning a trip to Kerala? Budgeting is key! So, let's talk money. You can expect to shell out around ₹2500/day for a budget trip, covering basic accommodation and local travel. This excludes the flight tickets, of course! For a more comfortable experience, budget closer to Rs. 5000 per diem.
normalised: Planning a trip to Kerala? Budgeting is key! So, let us talk money. You can expect to shell out around rupee two thousand five hundred per day for a budget trip, covering basic accommodation and local travel. This excludes the flight tickets, of course! For a more comfortable experience, budget closer to rupees five thousand per diem.

unnormalised: Accommodation varies wildly. Hostels are available for as little as ₹500 a night, while a decent hotel room could set you back Rs 2000 or more. Food costs can be kept low by eating at local eateries; a delicious thali can be had for ₹150! However, fancy restaurants in tourist hotspots like Fort Kochi can easily cost ₹800-1200 per person.
normalised: Accommodation varies wildly. Hostels are available for as little as rupee five hundred a night, while a decent hotel room could set you back rupees two thousand or more. Food costs can be kept low by eating at local eateries; a delicious thali can be had for rupee one hundred and fifty! However, fancy restaurants in tourist hotspots like Fort Kochi can easily cost rupee eight hundred to one thousand two hundred per person.

unnormalised: Transport-wise, buses are super economical, costing only a few rupees per km. Auto-rickshaws are common but remember to bargain! For longer distances, consider pre-booked cabs; Ola or Uber might charge you about ₹12/km. Houseboats in Alleppey can range from Rs. 8000 to ₹25000 for a day trip, depending on the luxury level.
normalised: Transport-wise, buses are super economical, costing only a few rupees per kilometer. Auto-rickshaws are common but remember to bargain! For longer distances, consider pre-booked cabs; Ola or Uber might charge you about rupee twelve per kilometer. Houseboats in Alleppey can range from rupees eight thousand to rupee twenty five thousand for a day trip, depending on the luxury level.

unnormalised: Don't forget entrance fees to attractions! Museums and historical sites often charge around ₹50-₹200. Also, keep in mind potential hidden costs like tips, souvenirs (a saree could cost anywhere from Rs. 500 to Rs. 5000!), and those tempting cups of chai that'll add up to about ₹20 each. Happy travels!
